intro: Lomatogonium chumbicum, commonly known as the Andean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are alternate and often have a lobed or toothed appearance, while its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow. Lomatogonium chumbicum is known for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
